title: How to Tether a Nikon D3100 Using digiCamControl

steps.headline: If you haven't gotten the software already, go to the website, download, and install it.
Connect the D3100 to the computer with a regular USB cable.
Be sure your camera is on.
Go to the Compression option and select RAW + JPEG.
steps.description: If you don't use RAW, then just select JPEG.

steps.headline: Set up your shot like you normally would.
steps.description: If you are learning, experiment. You won't know what will, and won't, work, until you try it.

steps.headline: Locate the 'button' at the top right of the screen.
steps.description: That is what will trigger your camera.

steps.headline: Click the button to take the photo.
steps.description: Here is a screenshot with a couple of images having been taken.

steps.headline: Open it up with the external viewer.

text: If you haven't gotten the software already, go to the website, download, and install it.  Connect the D3100 to the computer with a regular USB cable.  Be sure your camera is on.  Start up the software. It will recognize your camera. Go to the Compression option and select RAW + JPEG. If you don't use RAW, then just select JPEG. Set up your shot like you normally would. If you are learning, experiment. You won't know what will, and won't, work, until you try it. Locate the 'button' at the top right of the screen. That is what will trigger your camera. Click the button to take the photo. Here is a screenshot with a couple of images having been taken. Open it up with the external viewer.
